author: Staff Reporter
text:
Finance Minister O. Panneerselvam distributed goats worth Rs.42.56 lakh to 330 beneficiaries and inaugurated several buildings at villages in Bodi constituency on Monday.

During a whirlwind tour, he inaugurated a hostel building for BC students at Sillamarathupatti, Kallar students hostel at Margaiyankottai, high-mast lamps at Aranmanaipudur pass, PT Rajan Road, KRR Nagar, NRT Main Road, Market Road and Vengalanagar.

In Dindigul, Minister for Power R. Viswanathan inaugurated two sanitary complexes at Anjikulipatti and Ellapatti in Sanarpatti union on Sunday night. Both the ministers wanted to cover maximum number of villages at their respective constituencies.

The officials were under pressure over identifying beneficiaries and arranging meetings for distribution of freebies.

“Expedite pending

works before polls”

They were also advised to expedite all pending works as the Election Commission could announce the date for the Assembly election in March. Top-level officials did not even attend grievance day meetings as they were busy identifying beneficiaries.

Almost all projects were expedited on a war-footing to keep them ready for inauguration before the election.
title: Busy pampering at home base
